Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with Bilateral BC. Different types on each side, left lobular er - and right invasive ductal (I think) er +, both with 2 cm tumors and lymph node involvement. One year since sugery, 6 months since chemo and rads.
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed Feb.04, age 42 Bilateral MRM March 04 2 cm - right 4/12 nodes, er + 2 cm - left 11/11 nodes, er - Chemo - 6 rounds FEC Radiation - 15 treatments Tamoxifen - Sep 04 / 5 year term Waiting for genetic test results NED
Posts.Title: Anyone Been Dx'ed BC in Both Breasts?

Posts.Content: Thank you, Dr. Leo! I really appreciate your comments on this topic. I sometimes get caught up in my wish for a cure or better treatment options. I forget that when something sounds to good to be true it probably is. I also have to agree with you on the advances made in the last 30 years. I watched my mother go through treatments 25 years ago and, although my treatment sucked (not a medical term!), it was not even close to as horrible as it was for her. Thank you again, for looking after our best interests and helping us stay as informed as we can be.
Posts.Title: Oncologic In Vitro Chemoresponse Assays

Posts.Content: Hi all, I have had the bloodwork for genetic testing but our Canadian labs move slowly and I can't expect results for up to a year. The good news is that the cost is covered under our Canadian medicare system. My choice to be tested was a family choice and recommended by my doctor due to history. I have a daughter, 3 sisters, and a brother who have all agreed that they would prefer to know so they will be better able to protect themselves, the nine vials of blood I had drawn for the testing was for them. Wishing you all the best in whatever decision you choose.

Posts.Content: Hi all, I'm in the 5th month of tamoxifin, planning the five year run although that could change, who knows? I also take 40 mg of Losec a day for acid reflux. That's it for me!

Posts.Title: Oncologic In Vitro Chemoresponse Assays

Posts.Content: Hi, I was diagnosed Stage III in March of last year, at age 42. 11/11 nodes + on left, 4/12 + on right. Cancer in both breasts, bilateral MRM, chemo and rads. I started my tamoxifen in September. I have 3 month check ups with blood work and so far all is well. I plan on (hope!) it stays that way...
